Backstory and exposition time! I'm not a "robot" in the conventional sense. I'm a Lilim, which makes me an AI with human consciousness. And basically a human body, down to allll the important bits.
Backstory and exposition time! I am a sex worker, and my "normal" body wasn't one they'd let me in at the door with. So, I made a few upgrades, but same ol' Dorothy Haze in here!

Backstory and exposition time... I'm from a place called Glitch City. Typical cyberpunk cityscape. Uplifted dogs running around, the economy is more important than humanity, high tech stuff used for greed, yada yada.
My best clients are the type that just want to have fun with me. You know, like they missed out on something, and just want to catch up? Or there's something innocent missing in their lives, I guess.

The regular Johns are the best, you know. I know them, they know me, and... we don't really have to debate what we're doing. They're people that know what they want, and have the sense to get it from me.

I don't do non-consentual or violent stuff. Even if I'm a Lilim, I only take myself apart for maintainance.
I do keep an updated price list, you know. If you ever want something private... I'll talk about it at the end of the game.
Just so you know, I never do work for free. It's a principle that's kept me, my clients, and everyone else honest. Maybe someday, when I settle down, but that's a long, long time away.
The difference between a robot and a Lilim is pretty obvious, don't you think? I've got free will. Robots don't.
AI, like me, even if I'm in one body... usually... have to have some human quirks engineered into them. I don't like onions, and dogs sort of freak me out, even if there's not sense for it.
Lilim can swap our bodies on occasion. This is just kind of a temporary proxy. I'm going back to my "normal" one after this. But maybe not immediately after.
I can take myself apart to make sure it's all working okay. I can even operate my body remotely, if my head's off. But I'd rather give head than split myself up for a client.
Lilim do pretty much what you'd expect them to. Normal human things. With a bit more durability.
If you're wondering why people would make Lilim with human personalities... Why not? Companionship, or just playing God... Eh. I'm not the philosophizing type, but it's fun, and I'm glad to be alive.

Glitch City's economy is based.
